CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The low J SC values of P5 and P6 were unexpected , considering the lower band gaps of P5 ( 1.49 eV ) and P6 ( 1.55 eV ) compared to that of P7 ( 1.85 eV ).

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| P5 |
| P6 |
| P7 |

Explanation:
The paragraph mentions "P5", "P6", and "P7" as materials, so these are the valid entities to include in the table. Other words in the paragraph, such as "The", "of", "were unexpected", "considering", "lower band gaps", "compared to", and "that of", do not clearly refer to material names and should be ignored.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The low J SC values of P5 and P6 were unexpected , considering the lower band gaps of P5 ( 1.49 eV ) and P6 ( 1.55 eV ) compared to that of P7 ( 1.85 eV ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| lower band gaps of P5 (1.49 eV) |
| lower band gaps of P6 (1.55 eV) |
| that of P7 (1.85 eV) |
| J SC values of P5 |
| J SC values of P6 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| lower band gap of P5 (1.49 eV) |
| lower band gap of P6 (1.55 eV) |
| band gap of P7 (1.85 eV) |
| J SC values |
| of P5 |
| of P6 |

Note: "J" in J SC values is assumed to refer to the J-scans or J-V characteristics, which is a measurement of the current density vs voltage in a solar cell. Therefore, J SC values can be considered as material properties, specifically related to the performance of the solar cells made from the respective materials.
